item.description:
##Thoughts

After creating a project page for Spot the Docs, I decided to make one for the #100DaysOfCode challenge. I chose Jekyll because of its widespread adoption and its reputation for syncing with GitHub.

This will be much cleaner than re-editing log.md every so often.

Keep forgetting that I renamed GitHubâ€™s remote origin to github so I donâ€™t confuse myself with remote heroku.

MkDocsâ€™ built-in devserver (mkdocs serve) is a lot of fun. Auto-reload! Itâ€™s like instant render ðŸ’ž

Not a fan of Jekyllâ€™s, as I have to keep shutting down the server and restart whenever I make config changesâ€¦plus itâ€™s not instantaneous.


Todayâ€™s Projects

Spot the Docs

  • setup MkDocs
  • figured out gh-pages
  • setup Jekyll

Links

  • Spot the Docs: GitHub Page
  • #100DaysOfCode: GitHub Page

Thoughts

It sucks to get stumped on such simple stuff. Iâ€™m studying for the LSAT and there is a definite connect between the type of logic it tests and coding. One wrong misstep can lead down a rabbit hole of bad decisions. Today was that kind of day. But at least I can take steps to see what went wrong, and where.

Iâ€™m making the decision to work on the fundamentals. Practice makes perfectâ€¦or maybe just less rabbit holes.

â€¦& when did GitHub update their fonts!? :o

Todayâ€™s Projects

Spot the Docs

  • pushed to Heroku
  • pushed to GitHub

Links

  • Spot the Docs - GitHub
  • Spot the Docs - Heroku

Setting up my dev environment has become a lot easier over the years. I remember when it used to take me an entire day. Guess practice really does make things less burdensome.

Todayâ€™s Projects

Spot the Docs

  • dev env setup

Laptop is â€˜fixedâ€™. Hardwareâ€™s good but still having some random shut off issuesâ€¦thanks, Apple.

Working on a multimedia poetry project; CSS3 & JS for the titles are finished, plus spacing for the poem itself. Just need to figure out what the main text should do.

Projects

CSS Animations

Inspired by an old poetry collection I wrote called Tetronimoes. Wanted to see if a multimedia poem would be the best fit for a revised edition. - multimedia poem - shadows, position, & color transitions

Still waiting for Apple to fix my laptop. The good news is Iâ€™ve been getting reacquainted with Windowsâ€™ Command Line and Notepadâ€¦

360Â° YouTube Video Embeds + three.js

Just messing around. Trying to see if thereâ€™s a way to manipulate the 360 controller. Searched the YT API but it seems like that functionality isnâ€™t available, yet. Ideally would like to disable the mousedown / drag function and create a camera that follows mouse movement.

today was a hot day. disheartened over lack of support for 360Â° functionality (re: YouTube).

Link(s) to work

Now that Iâ€™ve got a homebase, itâ€™s nice to be doing work, again. I know the pitfalls of not practicing code; the 100 days idea is great for keeping your skills up when youâ€™re working on other projects. For now, Iâ€™m just using this as a way to improve my portfolio and resume, but Iâ€™d like to go back to my list of projects to one day build out (including Pipe Dream Tactics).
